SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.wtc.eclipse.platform.helpers
Interface IResourceHelper

public interface IResourceHelper

Helper for manipulating files and folders at a low level.

Method Summary

Method Detail

closeFile

void closeFile(IUIContext ui,
               IPath filePath)
closeFile - If the given file is open in an editor, close that editor. If that file is not open, then no-op

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - The full path (project included) of the file to close

copyFile

void copyFile(IUIContext ui,
              IPath sourceFilePath,
              IPath destinationFilePath)
copyFile - Copy a file from a location in the workspace to another location in the workspace. Force the copy such that the copied file will overwrite an existing file at the destination location

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
sourceFilePath - - The full path (project name included) of the file to copy
destinationFilePath - - The full path (project name included) of the location in which to copy the source file into

createFileFromInput

IFile createFileFromInput(IUIContext ui,
                          Plugin sourcePlugin,
                          IPath sourcePath,
                          IPath fullDestinationPath)
createFileFromInStream - Create a new, writable, file in the active workspace using the contents of the given file in the given plugin.**!! THIS METHOD SHOULD BE USED FOR MODEL TESTS ONLY SINCE IT DOES NOT USE THE UI !!**

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - Container plugin for the resources whose contents are to be used to create a new file
sourcePath - - The plugin relative path of the file whose contents are to be used to create a new file
fullDestinationPath - - The full path (project included) of the file to create

createFolder

void createFolder(IUIContext ui,
                  IPath folderPath)
createFolder - Create a new folder in a project.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
folderPath - - Full path (project name and new folder name included) of the folder to create Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder

createFolderViaAPI

IFolder createFolderViaAPI(IPath folderPath)
createFolderViaAPI - Use the API to create a new folder in a project.

Parameters:
folderPath - - Full path (project name and new folder name included) of the folder to create Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder
Returns:
IFolder - The created folder. Will return null if the given path is empty

createSimpleFile

IPath createSimpleFile(IUIContext ui,
                       IPath outputPath,
                       java.lang.String fileName)
createSimpleFile - Create a new file in the given location and with the given file name. Use the simple new file wizard to create the file

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
outputPath - - Full path (project included) of the folder in which to create the new file. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder
fileName - - Name of the file. Should not be null
Returns:
IPath - The full path (project name included) of the file just created

createZipCopy

void createZipCopy(IUIContext ui,
                   java.lang.String zipFileName,
                   java.io.File[] filesToZip,
                   java.io.FilenameFilter fileFilter)
Create a Zip file containing the contents of the given locations. If the locations are directories, recurse those directories and add all of the files and folders within those locations. Only add files that should be added according to the given file filters. The zip file will be created in the workspace directory under the 'results' sub-directory

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
zipFileName - - The name of the zip file to create. A timestamp will be added to this zip file name. For example, if the given name is "filename.zip" the zip file created will be "filename_yyyyMMdd_HHmmssSSS.zip"
filesToZip - - A list of file base locations to add to the zip file. Recurse through folders and add all contents under these root locations
fileFilter - - Indicates what files to add/ignore when copying files into the zip. For example, *.class files can be ignored and not added to the zip with a file filter

deleteFileOrFolder

void deleteFileOrFolder(IUIContext ui,
                        IPath path)
deleteFileOrFolder - deletes the identified file (or folder) at the given location.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for the UI generated input
path - - Full Path (project included) of the file (or folder) to delete Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder

deleteFileOrFolderViaAPI

void deleteFileOrFolderViaAPI(IUIContext ui,
                              IPath path)
Deletes the specified file or folder (recursively) at the specified full path using the API.

!! THIS METHOD SHOULD BE USED FOR API-DRIVEN TESTS ONLY SINCE IT DOES NOT USE THE UI !!

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for the UI generated input
path - - Full Path (project included) of the file or folder to delete. If a folder is specified, the contents are recursively deleted.

getFileContents

java.lang.String getFileContents(IFile sourceFile)
getFileContents - Return the contents of the given source as a string. This method issues TestCase failure if the contents cannot be extracted for any reason

Parameters:
sourceFile - - The workspace file whose contents are to be extracted. Should not be null
Returns:
String - The source file contents

getFileFromPlugin

java.io.File getFileFromPlugin(IUIContext ui,
                               java.lang.String pluginID,
                               IPath filePath)
getFileFromPlugin - A plugin can be loaded into a runtime in many ways. Use the eclipse plugin loader and the given plugin to find a file within the plugin.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
pluginID - - ID of a plugin in the workspace
filePath - - A plugin relative (plugin name NOT included) path to a resource within the plugin Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder/file.java
Returns:
File - extracted from the loaded plugin's resources

getFileFromPlugin

java.io.File getFileFromPlugin(IUIContext ui,
                               Plugin plugin,
                               IPath filePath)
getFileFromPlugin - A plugin can be loaded into a runtime in many ways. Use the eclipse plugin loader and the given plugin to find a file within the plugin.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - A plugin in the workspace. Typically found with the getDefault() method on the plugin
filePath - - A plugin relative (plugin name NOT included) path to a resource within the plugin Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder/file.java
Returns:
File - extracted from the loaded plugin's resources

getFileFromWorkspace

IFile getFileFromWorkspace(IUIContext ui,
                           IPath filePath)
getFileFromWorkspace - Translate the given path into an IFile in the workspace. Wait for the file to exist before returning it. If the file does not exist, then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) to a file in the workspace. Should not be null. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/MyFile.java
Returns:
IFile - extracted from the current workspace

getFileFromWorkspaceRoot

java.io.File getFileFromWorkspaceRoot(IUIContext ui,
                                      java.lang.String fileName)
getFileFromWorkspaceRoot - Find the workspace root location on disk, then get a * first order* child file from that location. This method is useful when getting build files generated to the workspace root.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
fileName - - The name of the file in the workspace root to retrieve. The location of the workspace root is implicit and not included in this name.
Ex: build.xml
Returns:
File - extracted from the current workspace root

getFileLength

int getFileLength(IFile sourceFile)
getFileLength - Return the length in characters of the contents of the given file. This method issues TestCase failure if the contents cannot be extracted for any reason

Parameters:
sourceFile - - The workspace file whose contents are to be extracted. Should not be null
Returns:
int - Length in characters of the given file

getFileTimestamp

long getFileTimestamp(IUIContext ui,
                      IPath filePath)
getFileTimestamp - Get the timestamp of a file in the current workspace. This test will issue a test case failure if the file could not be found for any reason

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI-generated input
filePath - - The full path (project included) to the file in the current workspace whose timestamp is to be retrieved. Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFile.txt
Returns:
long - The file's timestamp as milliseconds

importFiles

void importFiles(IUIContext ui,
                 Plugin sourcePlugin,
                 IPath importFromPath,
                 IPath toPath)
importFiles - Use the File -> Import -> File System dialog to import files from a given plugin's resources into the given workspace path. Will import all files under the given source path

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - Container plugin for the resources to import
importFromPath - - Path to the folder to import from Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder
toPath - - Full path (project name included) to the import to directory Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder

importFiles

void importFiles(IUIContext ui,
                 java.lang.String sourcePluginID,
                 IPath importFromPath,
                 IPath toPath)
importFiles - Use the File -> Import -> File System dialog to import files from a given plugin's resources into the given workspace path. Will import all files under the given source path

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePluginID - - ID of the container plugin for the resources to import. A test case failure will be issued if a plugin for the given ID is not found
importFromPath - - Path to the folder to import from Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder
toPath - - Full path (project name included) to the import to directory Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder

importFiles

void importFiles(IUIContext ui,
                 Plugin sourcePlugin,
                 IPath importFromPath,
                 IPath toPath,
                 boolean overwrite)
importFiles - Use the File -> Import -> File System dialog to import files from a given plugin's resources into the given workspace path. Will import all files under the given source path

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
sourcePlugin - - Container plugin for the resources to import
importFromPath - - Path to the folder to import from Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder
toPath - - Full path (project name included) to the import to directory Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder
overwrite - - overwrite existing files

moveFile

IPath moveFile(IUIContext ui,
               IPath filePath,
               IPath targetPath)
moveFile - Use the resource navigator to move a file in the workspace from the given source location to the given target location. The target location must exist before the move is executed. If the resource exists in the target location it will be overwritten

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - The full path (project included) of the file to move Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/sourceFolder/MyFile.jsp
targetPath - - The full path (project included) of the folder to move the given file to. This folder must already exist
IPath - - The full path (project included) of the file in its new location Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/targetFolder/MyFile.jsp

openFile

void openFile(IUIContext ui,
              IPath filePath)
openFile - Open the file at the given workspace relative path in the file-associated editor. If the file is already open, then this operation will bring that editor to the front

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) of the file to open Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/MyFile.jsp

setFileContents

void setFileContents(IUIContext ui,
                     IPath filePath,
                     Plugin sourcePlugin,
                     IPath sourceFilePath)
setFileContents - A shotgun approach to setting a file's contents where all the lines are replaced with the lines in the given file without recreating the file on disc.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - The full path (project name included) to the file whose contents are to be replaced Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/MyFile.jsp
sourcePlugin - - The plugin containing the file whose contents will be placed into the workspace file
sourceFilePath - - The path in the source plugin of the file whose contents are to be used

verifyFileByBlock

void verifyFileByBlock(IUIContext ui,
                       Plugin plugin,
                       IPath baselineFilePath,
                       IPath filePath)
verifyFileByBlock - Use a block comparison (the baseline file is a block that must exist in the given source file) to compare the given file. If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given file has a block difference (the block does not exist or the block contains differences) then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/testfiles/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given baseline resource Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java

verifyFileByLine

void verifyFileByLine(IUIContext ui,
                      Plugin plugin,
                      IPath baselineFilePath,
                      IPath filePath)
verifyFileByLine - Use a line-by-line exact match comparison to compare the given file. If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given file has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/myFolder/file.txt
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given baseline resource Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java

verifyFileByLineSet

void verifyFileByLineSet(IUIContext ui,
                         Plugin plugin,
                         IPath baselineFilePath,
                         IPath filePath)
verifyFileByLineSet - Compare the lines of the given file as a set ( lines must exist but order is not important). If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given file has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given baseline resource Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java

verifyFileByLineSet

void verifyFileByLineSet(IUIContext ui,
                         Plugin plugin,
                         IPath baselineFilePath,
                         java.lang.String[] actualLines)
verifyFileByLineSet - Compare the lines of the given file as a set ( lines must exist but order is not important). If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given file has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
actualLines - - A set of lines to be checked

verifyFileByLineWithIgnores

void verifyFileByLineWithIgnores(IUIContext ui,
                                 Plugin plugin,
                                 IPath baselineFilePath,
                                 IPath filePath,
                                 java.lang.String ignorePattern)
verifyFileByLineWithIgnores - Use a line-by-line exact match comparison to compare the given file. If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. Ignore differences between the two files for all actual file lines that match the given regular expression. If the given file has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given baseline resource Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java
ignorePattern - - Ignore lines (do not perform a diff) where the source file matches this regular expression

verifyFileByRegexLine

void verifyFileByRegexLine(IUIContext ui,
                           Plugin plugin,
                           IPath baselineFilePath,
                           IPath filePath)
verifyFileByRegexLine - Use a line-by-line regular expression comparison to compare the given file. If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given files has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given baseline resource Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java

verifyFileByString

void verifyFileByString(IUIContext ui,
                        java.lang.String baselineString,
                        IPath filePath,
                        boolean exists)
verifyFileByString - Verify that the given String exists in the given workspace file. The String *must not* span multiple lines since this comparison will search line by line in the given file. The given String does not need to be a full line of text and will be considered a match if a line of text in the given file contains the String.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
baselineString - - A single line of text (does not need to be a complete line) to search for in the given file.
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file that is to be compared with the given String Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java
exists - - True if the text should exist in the target file for the verification to succeed; False if the text should not exist for the verification to succeed

verifyFileExists

void verifyFileExists(IUIContext ui,
                      IPath filePath,
                      boolean exists)
verifyFileExists - Wait until the file at the given path exists. If the file still does not exist after 30 seconds, then issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file whose existence is to be verified Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java
exists - - True if the file is to exist for this condition to be satisfied

verifyFileExists

void verifyFileExists(IUIContext ui,
                      Plugin plugin,
                      IPath filePath,
                      boolean exists)
verifyFileExists - Wait until the file at the given path exists. If the file still does not exist after 2 seconds, then issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The test plugin containing the file to check for
filePath - - Plugin relative path to the file whose existence is to be verified
exists - - True if the file is to exist for this condition to be satisfied

verifyFileExists

void verifyFileExists(IUIContext ui,
                      java.lang.String pluginID,
                      IPath filePath,
                      boolean exists)
verifyFileExists - Wait until the file at the given path exists. If the file still does not exist after 2 seconds, then issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
pluginID - - The ID of the test plugin containing the file to check for
filePath - - Plugin relative path to the file whose existence is to be verified
exists - - True if the file is to exist for this condition to be satisfied

verifyFileUpdated

void verifyFileUpdated(IUIContext ui,
                       IPath filePath,
                       long timestamp,
                       boolean wasUpdated)
verifyFileUpdated - Wait until the file at the given path exists and has a modifaction timestamp greater than the given timestap. If the file does not meet these criteria after 30 seconds then issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) to the file whose existence and timestamp is to be verified
timestamp - - Value of the timestamp that is to be compared against
wasUpdated - - True if the file should have been updated since the the last time the timestamp was checked; false if the should should not have been updated

verifyFolderExists

void verifyFolderExists(IUIContext ui,
                        IPath folderPath,
                        boolean exists)
verifyFolderExists - Wait until the folder at the given path exists. If the folder still does not exist after 30 seconds, then issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
folderPath - - Full path (project included) to the folder whose existence is to be verified Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder
exists - - True if the folder is to exist for this condition to be satisfied

verifyStringByRegexFileLine

void verifyStringByRegexFileLine(IUIContext ui,
                                 Plugin plugin,
                                 IPath baselineFilePath,
                                 java.lang.String contents)
verifyStringByRegexFileLine - Use a line-by-line regular expression comparison to compare the given String to a baseline file (compile the lines in the baseline file as patterns). If the baseline file could not be found or the source file could not be found then this method will issue a TestCase failure. If the given files has a line difference then this method will issue a TestCase failure

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
plugin - - The source plugin where the baseline file is located
baselineFilePath - - A plugin relative path (plugin NOT included) to the baseline file containing a block of text to compare against. Ex: resources/expected/TestName/ProjectName/folder/file.txt
actual - - The contenst to be compared with the given baseline resource

writeFileContents

void writeFileContents(IUIContext ui,
                       IPath filePath,
                       java.lang.String contents)
writeFileContents - Write a file to disk and set its contents to the given text.

Parameters:
ui - - Driver for UI generated input
filePath - - Full path (project included) of the file to create. If the project doesn't exist or is not accessible, an assertion error will be thrown. Folders that do not exist will be created Ex: RuntimeTestProject/src/myFolder/File.java
contents - - The contents to write to the file
